description: Sum of divisors of n not congruent to 0 mod 3.
formula: Multiplicative with a(3^e) = 1, a(p^e) = (p^(e+1)-1)/(p-1) for p<>3. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 11 2002G.f.: Sum_{k>0} x^k*(1+2*x^k+2*x^(3*k)+x^(4*k))/(1-x^(3*k))^2. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 18 2002a(n)=A000203(3n)-3*A000203(n). - _Labos Elemer_, Aug 14 2003Equals A051731 * A091684, where A051731 = the inverse Mobius transform and A091684 = count with 3*n = 0: (1, 2, 0, 4, 5, 0, 7,...). Example: a(4) = 7 = (1, 1, 0, 1) dot (1, 2, 0, 4) = (1 + 2 + 0 + 4), where (1, 1, 0, 1) = row 4 of A051731. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 03 2008Dirichlet g.f. zeta(s)*zeta(s-1)*(1-1/3^(s-1)). - R. J. Mathar, Feb 10 2011G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = f(A(x), A(x^2), A(x^4)) where f(u, v, w)= u^2 + 9 * v^2 + 16 * w^2 - 6 * u*v + 4 * u*w - 24 * v*w - v + w. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 19 2004
mathematica: Table[DivisorSigma[1, 3*w]-3*DivisorSigma[1, w], {w, 1, 256}]DivisorSum[#1, # &, Mod[#, 3] != 0 &] & /@ Range[68] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jun 30 2013 *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, sigma(3*n) - 3 * sigma(n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Jul 19 2004 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
